subject: Cybersecurity
title: Privileged Access Management: Guarding the Super Users
description: A micro-lesson that makes Privileged Access Management: Guarding the Super Users usable.

hook.text: A database admin's credentials can delete every record in the company. What happens when those credentials are stolen?

buildup.text: Privileged accounts (root, admin, DBA) have elevated permissions. PAM systems vault these credentials and control.

discovery.text: PAM provides just-in-time access: admins check out credentials for a specific task, then they're automatically rotated.

twist.text: 80% of breaches involve compromised privileged credentials. Attackers don't hack systems â€“ they log in.

climax.text: Privileged access is the ultimate prize. PAM ensures that even admins must prove need, get approval, and be recorded.

punchline.text: Hackers don't break in. They log in as the admin.

quiz.question: What percentage of breaches involve compromised privileged credentials?
